docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: NOTE: This Lab will be added with 2025.06 release when Build is integrated into the platform

docs.title: Deploy Lab
docs.text:
This lab will provide you with a practical hands-on for deploying an application to target server.

Note: 1. This supports agent-based installation so that you can install your application on any kind of environment, be it On-Prem, IBM Cloud, Azure, AWS, GCP, Mainframes, etc. 2. In this demo, our agent is running on the IBM cloud, so we will deploy our application on the IBM cloud

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
DevOps Deploy is a rich tool and provides excellent mechanisms to control the deployment of application. A simple architecture is Application > Environment(DEV, QA, PROD, etc.) > Components

In order to deploy application, please download the Application file (https://github.com/DevOpsAutomationLabs/End2End/blob/main/PizzaApp.json) open it on your preferred editor, and update the following in the file. 1. Search for "name": "PizzaApp" and replace it with your student code (xx appended to your email id. eg., "name": "PizzaApp-01") 2. Search for "name": "PizzaApp-Container" and replace it with your student code (xx appended to your email id. eg., "name": "PizzaApp-Container-01") 3. Search for "commandOptions": "-d -p ${p:port}:8000" and replace it with your student code (30xx appended with to email id. eg., "commandOptions": "-d -p 3001:8000") . Troubleshooting: If you see any issue, try to update the port like 3070,3071, etc... 4. Save the file.

docs.title: Upload this to DevOps Deploy:
docs.text:
Go to DevOps Deploy > Applications > Import Application > (Scroll down) Choose File > Select your updated file > Submit

Once you import the application, you would be able to see additional application listes like:

docs.title: Build image and publish to Deploy
docs.text:
1. Open http://165.192.86.196:8080/
  2. Click on New Item and provide description as : App-01 (01 is your student ID as mentioned in your email)
  3. Choose pipeline, press Ok
  4. Copy the content available on https://github.com/DevOpsAutomationLabs/End2End/blob/main/Jenkins
  5. Under Pipeline script, paste the content copied, and then update the component name with student code: (replace XX with student code, eg: 01)

docs.title: Update the resource Tree:
docs.text: Do not forget to do this important step once you can successfully run the Jenkins command: Navigate to DevOps Devloy > Resources> Resource Tree > Click on 3 dots > Add Component (your component name: PizzaApp-Container-01)

docs.title: Final steps for Deployment:
docs.text:
1. Click on your Application
  2. DEV > Click "Request Process"
  3. Click "Choose Component Version"`
  1. A right panel will open, click on Add , the drop-down"By Version Lookup" Select the first available
  2. Click on Submit

  3. Expand the process and check the deployment process.

docs.title: GO TO Test Section: Click Here
Start Here
docs.text: To use the platform you have to be onboarded onto it. This is normaly done by your administrators. For this lab we have provided you with pre created accounts. These will be handed out to you at the lab session.

docs.title: How to log in
docs.text:
Please navigate to the given Labsession URL and enter your provided credentials in the Login Screen:

and press the Sign In Button.

docs.title: The Home Page
docs.text:
After you have been logged in you will be directed to your homepage:

On this page the available capabilities of the platform will be provided for you. By clicking on the "Let's go to ..." button(s) the capability provider will be opened in a new tab of your browser.

Another way to switch between capabilities is to use the central app switcher:

docs.title: About Box and Logging out
docs.text:
On the above right side of your page you have the buttons for viewing the About box:

By pressing the About button the Information about the platform version and copyright will be presented. Please close by clicking on the "x" symbol on popup.

You can always log out of the platform by pressing the user symbol:

After a secure log out you will be presented with a new page which provides a login again:

docs.title: Sidebar
docs.text:
On the left side of the page you will have the side bar which will provide context related menu:

You can expand the side bar with the expand button on the bottom left side of the page:

Which will provide the sidebar items with text details:

docs.title: Plug-Ins
docs.text: On the sidebar a view of slected plug-ins is available. By pressing on the Plug-Ins symbol the Featured Plugins page will be presented:

docs.title: Conclusio
docs.text: Congratulations! You have now explored the home page of DevOps Automation platform. Please proceed with the next lab.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: TODO: add here more about Plan

docs.title: How to switch to Plan from Home Page
docs.text:
You can switch to Plan by either pressing "Let's go to Plan" button on its tile:

Or you can always switch using the central app switcher on the top left of your screen:

docs.title: Select Plan application to use
docs.text:
If you have not set your default Plan application you will be provided with a screen with all applications you have access to.

Set the provided app as default and presss "Let's go" to proceed.

docs.title: Welcome Page for first time users
docs.text:
If you have logged in the first time into Plan you will get a Welcome Screen:

By pressing the button "Explore" a new page is shown which provides an Introduction to Plan and the used workflow model for the selected application:

docs.title: Use Home Button to switch to Plan Home Page
docs.text:
Please use the "Home" button on the left sidebar to switch to the Home page for Plan.

This Home page will provide you some basic information and also the means to switch between Plan applications (My Applications Button on the right)

The explore options on this page will forward you to the Exploration page mentioned above.

docs.title: Explore the technical worflow
docs.text:
Pressing the button "View":

will open a new view to the technical details of the used workflow for the selected application.

This view provides the used record types, fields, transition matrizes and more.

docs.title: Project Board
docs.text: view around

Create and customize a new Project
Attach the Releases, Sprints and Components to the Project
Introduction
docs.text: NOTE: This Lab will be added with 2025.09 release of the platform when Security and Vulnerability Testing will be integrated into the platform

docs.title: Test Lab
docs.text: This lab will provide you with a practical hands-on of our testing capabilities. You can click on the main menu and navigate to the DevOps test.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Click on DevOps Test to naviagte to DevOps Test.

Click on the PizzaApp project, which has tests for our target Application.

Click on gear icon to look more configuration. It provides the git location where the test scripts are being hosted:

Now You can click on tests which we have already executed using DevOps Deploy:

Clicking on functional report will provide complete insights of the test:

Explore more results by clicking on available options:
